intro: Ossaea asperifolia, commonly known as the roughleaf ossaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its dense, wiry stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming during the warmer months. Ossaea asperifolia is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
